title: Global Community Integration Report - Greek, Jewish, and All Communities

communities.name: Greek Cypriot Brotherhood
communities.description: Oldest Cypriot association in Britain (founded 1934). Based in North London. Cultural and community hub. Educational, cultural, and advocacy activities.
communities.notes: 2 Britannia Road, London N12 9RU. Preserves heritage, organizes cultural events, advocates for Cyprus reunification.

communities.name: National Federation of Cypriots in the UK
communities.description: Representative umbrella organization for Cypriots in the UK. Coordinates refugee organizations, village organizations, educational societies, cultural groups.
communities.notes: Economic Diplomacy Roundtable. Founded after 1974 Turkish invasion.

communities.name: NEPOMAK UK
communities.description: Young Cypriots across the UK. Social, cultural and networking events. Museum visits, language lessons, boat parties, professional networking.
communities.notes: Promotes Cypriot culture and heritage for young people.

communities.name: SAE - World Council of Hellenes Abroad
communities.description: Main representative body for people of Greek descent worldwide. Founded 1995 in Thessaloniki. Advisory body to Greek state on diaspora matters.
communities.notes: Brings together Greeks of the Diaspora creating a global Network. Planning and materializing programmes for the benefit of the Omogeneia.

communities.name: Hellenes Abroad
communities.description: Vibrant community platform connecting Greeks globally. Cultural events, language programs, professional networking, business opportunities, philanthropic initiatives.
communities.notes: Preserves Greek heritage while facilitating international connections.

communities.name: The Hellenic Initiative
communities.description: Global organization with chapters in multiple countries (Australia, Canada). Summer Youth Academy, Venture Impact Awards, volunteer initiatives.
communities.notes: Multiple country chapters.

communities.name: Board of Deputies of British Jews
communities.description: Primary representative body for British Jewish community. Established 1760. Democratically elected, cross-communal organization. 320+ Deputies representing synagogues and Jewish organizations.
communities.notes: Only democratically elected, cross-communal representative body.

communities.name: Cyprus Jewish Community
communities.description: Approximately 11,000 Jewish residents. Expatriates from Israel, Russia, UK, plus Ukrainian refugees. Five synagogues across Nicosia, Limassol, Larnaca, Ayia Napa.
communities.notes: Educational facilities and kosher services available.

communities.name: Commonwealth Jewish Council
communities.description: Represents Jewish communities across Commonwealth nations, including Cyprus.
communities.notes: Commonwealth-wide network.

communities.name: World Jewish Congress (WJC)
communities.description: Primary international representative body. Convenes senior professionals from affiliated Jewish communities across dozens of countries. National Community Directors' Forum (NCDF).
communities.notes: Programs: Combating antisemitism, Holocaust education, youth leadership (WJC Elevate).

communities.name: The Jewish Agency for Israel
communities.description: Operates in 65+ countries worldwide. Strengthens Jewish communities globally. Programs: Aliyah, Shlichut (Israeli emissaries), Partnership2Gether (city-to-city connections).
communities.notes: Creates connections between diaspora communities and Israel.

communities.name: Global Jewry
communities.description: Connector and resource hub for Jewish organizations. Advisory board and organizational partners working across the diaspora.
communities.notes: Resource hub for global Jewish network.

communities.name: Mem Global
communities.description: Modern diaspora network. 800 community builders across 25+ countries. 72,205 program participants in 2025. Focus: Jewish young adults.
communities.notes: Moishe House and local community hubs. Young adult focus.

communities.name: Council of Turkish Cypriot Associations (CTCA) UK
communities.description: Britain's largest Turkish Cypriot umbrella organization. Established 1983. 300,000-strong community. 20+ member associations.
communities.notes: Annual Turkish Cypriot Cultural Festival. Century-long presence in UK (as of 2017).

communities.name: Turkish Cypriot Community Association (TCCA)
communities.description: Multi-award-winning charity. Operating since 1976. Services: Turkish Cypriot, Turkish, Greek Cypriot, Kurdish speakers. Homecare, training, community facilities.
communities.notes: TC Homecare provides culturally specific services. Turkish Cypriot Arts and Cultural Festival.

communities.name: Hackney Cypriot Association (HCA)
communities.description: Established 1976. Uniquely brings together Greek and Turkish-speaking Cypriots despite cultural tensions. Bilingual staff and volunteers. Recreational activities, Advice and Translation Office, health workshops.
communities.notes: 5 Balls Pond Road since 1982. Lunch club, film club, pop-up restaurant. Unites Greek and Turkish Cypriots.

communities.name: UK Cypriot and Jewish Diasporas Cooperation
communities.description: Strong cooperative bonds between UK Cypriot and Jewish diasporas. Joint events at Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting. Historical connections dating to Biblical times.
communities.notes: 2018: 'A Celebration of Cypriot and Jewish Communities in the Commonwealth'. Strategic ties between Cyprus and Israel.

communities.name: Cypriot Federation Diaspora Bonds
communities.description: Cypriot Federation has built closer bonds with Jewish, Armenian, Kurdish, and Alevi diasporas in the UK.
communities.notes: Multi-diaspora cooperation and partnerships.

communities.name: INTRAC Cyprus Civil Society Strengthening
communities.description: Research and capacity-building programs (2007-2011). Examined how Turkish Cypriot and Greek Cypriot civil society worked to promote trust, cooperation and reconciliation.
communities.notes: Training workshops, technical assistance, dialoguing events. Resources on building trust and civil society development.

communities.name: UK Cypriot Professionals Network
communities.description: Mentorship, networking opportunities, career development resources for Cypriot professionals across multiple industries.
communities.notes: Part of National Federation of Cypriots.
